name: Cognitive Restructuring
description: Challenge and reframe negative thought patterns by identifying cognitive distortions and replacing them with more balanced, realistic thoughts. Helps patients recognize automatic negative thoughts and develop alternative interpretations.

name: Behavioral Activation
description: Schedule and engage in positive, meaningful activities to improve mood and reduce avoidance behaviors. Patients identify valued activities and gradually increase engagement to combat depression and anxiety.

name: Exposure Therapy
description: Gradual, systematic exposure to anxiety-provoking situations or stimuli to reduce fear and avoidance. Uses hierarchy-based approach to help patients confront and overcome phobias and anxiety triggers.

name: Thought Records
description: Track and analyze automatic thoughts using structured worksheets. Patients document situations, emotions, automatic thoughts, evidence for/against thoughts, and alternative responses to develop cognitive flexibility.

name: Activity Scheduling
description: Plan structured daily activities to improve mood, productivity, and sense of accomplishment. Includes scheduling pleasant events, mastery activities, and breaking down tasks into manageable steps.

name: Mindfulness Practice
description: Cultivate present-moment awareness without judgment through meditation, breathing exercises, and mindful observation. Helps patients observe thoughts and emotions without being overwhelmed by them.

name: Distress Tolerance Skills
description: Learn strategies to manage crisis situations without making them worse. Includes TIPP skills, radical acceptance, distraction techniques, and self-soothing methods for intense emotional moments.

name: Emotion Regulation
description: Understand and manage intense emotions through identifying emotions, reducing vulnerability, increasing positive experiences, and applying opposite action. Builds emotional awareness and control.

name: Interpersonal Effectiveness
description: Assert needs and maintain healthy boundaries while preserving relationships. Uses DEAR MAN, GIVE, and FAST skills to navigate interpersonal conflicts and communicate effectively.

name: TIPP Skills
description: Crisis intervention using Temperature (cold water on face), Intense exercise, Paced breathing, and Paired muscle relaxation. Rapidly reduces emotional arousal during acute distress.

name: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
description: Systematically tense and relax muscle groups throughout the body to reduce physical tension and promote relaxation. Teaches body awareness and stress reduction through controlled muscle exercises.

name: Deep Breathing Exercises
description: Diaphragmatic breathing exercises to activate the parasympathetic nervous system and reduce anxiety. Includes techniques like 4-7-8 breathing, box breathing, and belly breathing.

name: Guided Imagery
description: Visualize calming scenes or positive experiences to reduce stress and anxiety. Uses multi-sensory imagination to create mental safe spaces and promote relaxation responses.

name: Autogenic Training
description: Self-induced relaxation through verbal cues focused on heaviness, warmth, and calm. Patients learn phrases to promote physical relaxation and mental tranquility.

name: Sleep Hygiene
description: Improve sleep quality through behavioral changes including consistent sleep schedule, bedroom environment optimization, limiting caffeine/screens, and establishing bedtime routines.

name: Assertiveness Training
description: Express needs, opinions, and boundaries effectively while respecting others. Learn to distinguish between passive, aggressive, and assertive communication styles and practice assertive responses.

name: Contingency Management
description: Use rewards and positive reinforcement to strengthen desired behaviors and reduce problematic behaviors. Involves identifying target behaviors, setting goals, and implementing reward systems.

name: Behavioral Experiments
description: Test beliefs and predictions through structured real-world experiments. Patients design experiments to gather evidence about their thoughts and assumptions, promoting cognitive change through experience.

name: Problem-Solving Training
description: Systematic approach to identifying problems, generating solutions, evaluating options, and implementing action plans. Teaches structured decision-making and coping skills for life challenges.

name: Values Clarification
description: Identify core personal values and align behaviors with what matters most. Helps patients make decisions consistent with their values and increase sense of meaning and purpose.
